title: VA - Latin Spectrum II (2000)@flac
description: https://i.imgur.com/TiUSWUa.jpg 01. Tito Puente - Corta El Bonche [4:19] 02. Justo Betancourt - Ella Esta En Otre Rumba [5:01] 03. Bobby Cruz - Que Se Vaya [4:20] 04. Johnny Colon - Retorno Del Mambo [5:34] 05. Ray Barretto - Guarare [5:39] 06. Roberto Roena - Hay Que Saber Comenzar [6:48] 07. Gil Lopez & Sonny Bravo - Canuto [4:00] 08. Nestor Torres - Tierra Colora [7:50] 09. Willie Garcia - Arinara [2:44] 10. Bobby Cruz - Bomba Camara [5:45] 11. Papo Luca & La Sonora Poncena - Algo Facil [5:13] 12. Angel Canales - Sabor Los Rumberos Nuevos [4:20] 13. The Tommy Olivencia Orchestra - Periquito Pin Pin [4:25] 14. La Compania Orchestra - Celito Lindo [5:07] 1. "El Rey" Tito Puente reigns supreme from his 'Carnaval In Harlem' LP. Vocals by the late Santos Colon. Tlco 1966. 2. Listen to the rhythms of Justo Betancourt the Cuban born sonero and his Cuban band. Raymond (Peewe) Lopez solo on the bongos. Fania 1978 . 3. Ricardo Ray's 'Jala Y Bogaloo' LP from a great time in Latin Music with vocals by Bobby Cruz. Allegre 1967. 4. From 'The Tierra Va A Temblar' LP. Johnny Colon is one of the greatest musicians from Spanish Harlem. His skills are demonstrated on Piano and vocais. Cotique 1975. 5. This is the jam from which the group Guarare evolved. Vocals Tito Gomez. Fania 1976. 6. Roberto Roena master on bongos and his Apollo sound. Timbale solo by Domingo (Cugut) Santos. International 1977. 7. Vocals by Adalberto Santiago. 8. Nestor Torres’s master flute from his 'Orchestra Afro Charanga Vol 2'. A great jam and a must LP. Disc Makers Philadelphia USA 1980. 9. The Joe Cuba Sextet once again doing It right. Vocals Wilie Garcia. Tico 1973. 10. Another track from the 'Jala Y Boogaloo' LP. Vocals Bobby Cruz. Allegre 1967. 11. From one of the top Latin Orchestra's of all time 'Night Raider' LP. Inca 1981. 12. From his 'Sabor Con' LP. Musical Director & on trombone Juan Torres. Allegre 1975. 13. Vocals Hector Tricoche. Arranged by Jose Pajai. 14. From 'The Latin from Manhattan' LP. Flute, Tenor/Soprano Sax & Piano Bobby Rodriguez with his La Campania Orchestra. Lead Vocals Junior Cordova. Vaya 1978. Compilation and A&R Directiom Hector Torres. Mastered by Shawn at Tape To Tape. BBS Thanks: Hector Torres for delivering this beautiful album. Kenny Dope for introducing me to his uncle Hector. All the beautiful Latin women. Label: BBE Released: 05 Jun 2000 Catalogue: BBE CD 032 Codec: Flac Compression Level: 6 Quality: High CD-rip by alekow (EAC and Flac) Covers Included (600dpi) Enjoy, Seed and Share
